intro: Cinchona forbesiana, commonly known as the Forbes' quinine tree, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain seeds, and it is known for its historical role in the production of quinine, a medicinal compound used to treat malaria. Cinchona forbesiana thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes, typically in cloud forests.
